title.rendered: Cape Town vs Eastern Cape, South Africa T20 League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Jofra Archer was rested in the last game.

Cape Town: Dewald Brevis, Ryan Rickelton, Rassie van der Dussen, Grant Roelofsen (wk), Sam Curran, George Linde, Delano Potgieter, Odean Smith, Rashid Khan (c), Kagiso Rabada, Olly Stone

Eastern Cape: Sarel Erwee, Adam Rossington (wk), JJ Smuts, Jordan Cox, Aiden Markram (c), Tristan Stubbs, Roelof van der Merwe, Marco Jansen, James Fuller, Sisanda Magala, Ottniel Baartman

Pitch Report

Venue: Newlands, Cape Town

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 133

2nd innings average score: 167

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Batting becomes easier in the second innings

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 100%

Also Read:

India vs New Zealand, 2nd ODI, 2023: Fantasy Team

Fantasy Tips of the Day

George Linde has great numbers not only for the season but also at the venue. In 23 T20s at Cape Town, he has scored 226 runs at 28 and taken 25 wickets with an economy of 7 RPO.

Dewald Brevis’ scores at the venue read 70*, 0, and 42. In his defence, Kyle Mayers bowled a searing yorker to dismiss him for a duck. He, otherwise, has been a delight to watch.

Aiden Markram has featured in the Ultimate Team in all three games of the season, generating fantasy points with both bat and ball.

In the bowling category, Sisanda Magala and Ottniel Baartman have the Ultimate Team percentage of 100. Picking bowlers from the Eastern Cape has been a straightforward affair in fantasy leagues.

Although Cape Town is studded with star bowlers, the bulk of the wickets have come from Olly Stone. While Rashid Khan has gone wicketless twice, Kagiso Rabada and Jofra Archer continue to be rotated.

In the last 3 games, an average of 3 wickets fell in the second innings compared to 8 wickets in the first.
